clinical_study.brief_title: Oncological and Functional Outcomes After Radical Prostatectomy for Prostate Cancer: Comparing Open With Robot-assisted Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Oncological and Functional Outcomes After Radical Prostatectomy for Prostate Cancer: Comparing Open With Robot-assisted Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: For primary surgical treatment of prostate cancer the investigators compare the classic open surgery (radical retropubic prostatectomy, RRP) versus robot-assisted laparoscopic surgery (RALP). Oncological results are obtained at standard follow-up consultations through Prostate-Specific Antigen (PSA) measurement to detect biochemical recurrence. Functional results (continence, potency, quality of life) are obtained through standardised questionnaires. Currently the investigators perform all of their prostatectomies in a robot-assisted manner. For results of the open surgery the investigators send questionnaires to patients who had the operation in the past.

primary_outcome.description: PSA measurement in the serum should not be > or = 0,20 ng/ml.
PSA measurement in the serum should not be > or = 0,20 ng/ml.
PSA measurement in the serum should not be > or = 0,20 ng/ml.
PSA measurement in the serum should not be > or = 0,20 ng/ml.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 6-monthly follow up between 1 and 5 years after prostatectomy.
primary_outcome.description: PSA measurement in the serum should not be > or = 0,20 ng/ml.

secondary_outcome.description: Patients need to fill out questionnaires (EORTC QLQ-C30, QLQ-PR25, ICIQ mLUTS and UI SF and IIEF). The patients in the radical retropubic prostatectomy group only fill out the questionnaires once.
Patients need to fill out questionnaires (EORTC QLQ-C30, QLQ-PR25, ICIQ mLUTS and UI SF and IIEF). The patients in the radical retropubic prostatectomy group only fill out the questionnaires once.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional assessment concerning quality of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Patients need to fill out questionnaires (EORTC QLQ-C30, QLQ-PR25, ICIQ mLUTS and UI SF and IIEF). The patients in the radical retropubic prostatectomy group only fill out the questionnaires once.

arm_group.description: Men who underwent open radical prostatectomy in the past at our centre.
Men who undergo robot-assisted laparoscopic prostatectomy at our centre.

study_pop.textblock: Men who were surgically treated or who are being surgically treated for prostate cancer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- prostate cancer
- radical retropubic prostatectomy or
- robot-assisted laparoscopic surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
